commits.message: add README.rst with basic info and things to do
add verdigris app icon
add GPL v3 license + copyright statement in HNY.java

add `info' dialogue

* add `info' button in the bottom-right corner
* open `info' dialogue with link to verdigris.mu, Twitter
  handle and legal statements
* re-arrange layout with RelativeLayout
* tydi-up HNY a bit

update vibes sounds (now tuned with guitar & voice)

The guitar and voice sounds were in tune with an old
piano which was not at 440Hz.  The vibes sounds are
from a standard concert picth 440Hz instrument, so
now they've been lowered to be in tune with the rest.
It could all be recorded again at 440Hz since the
piano with the lower pitch is not actually being used
in the end...
add vibes icons (res/drawable/vibes{_off})
HNY: allow 0 voices + tweak timings a bit

HNY: basic code review

* use `final' and `static' wherever appropriate
* tidy-up class members

add VibesButton and add one for each part

* add on/off vibes buttons and use associated images
* add VibesButton class to handle on/off toggles
  (no parameters for the vibes notes)
HNY: add vibes arpeggios
rename START -> PLAY button text

HNY: store the sound labels within each category

The top-level map contains categories such as "guitar" or
"silence".  Now each category is also a map with a label
for each sound, typically with note names such as "g1" or
"c3". The behaviour hasn't changed yet, but this allows
selecting notes for their musical notes instead of just
plain categories.

update res/raw/*.ogg files

* rename without unnecessary prefix (only 1 sound of
  each kind)
* add vibraphone sounds
set default voice values to 1, 2, 3

use ImageButton for +/- controls + tweak layout

* add plus.png and minus.png from the Tango icon library
  http://tango.freedesktop.org/Tango_Icon_Library
* use ImageButton instead of Button MyNumberPicker
* change font size and alignment of labels and control
  button so it's centered and clear to use
* use style inheritance to simplify styles.xml
add current res/raw/*.ogg sound files

stop using NumberPicker (and go back to API 10)

* add HNY.MyNumberPicker class which is not really a widget
  but a basic helper built on 2 buttons and a text view
* replace android.widget.NumberPicker with MyNumberPicker

update button text with current state

Show START, STOP and Stopping... on the button.

HNY: synchronize threads and add state value

* add HNY.state with idle, running or stopping
* synchronize all accesses to the state variable
  between main thread and sequencer thread
* do not wait for thread to join when stopping
  (to not block main thread when pressing the
  button)
* log state transitions
tweak loop timing + default 2 voices
add counter to check all sounds are really loaded
HNY: use random balance

HNY: insert short silence before starting sequencer

This is to avoid synchronization issues as the player
takes some time to get initialised (and timing is done
with basic sleep calls...).
center labels above number pickers

HNY.SequenceThread.playRandom: fix logic for n voices

* pick up to 3 sounds within the given list
  (used to be fixed to 1 or 2 with inefficient loop)
* remove playAll as it's not used
  (can in fact be achieved by calling playRandom with
  n equal to the number of sounds in the list...)
main.xml: add basic labels next to number pickers
HNY: set default number picker values to 1
res/values/string.xml: update app and button texts

AndroidManifest.xml: set rotation to be fixed to portrait

This is to avoid badly handled transitions when the app is
rotated...  It could just be improved to support rotation
nicely.

add number pickers for the number of voices for each word

* temporarily update project from API 10 to 17
  (NumberPicker was introduced in API 11)
* add number pickers for each word and use their
  values in the sequence
styles.xml: disable button text appearence settings for now

add sound pool listener to know when sounds are loaded

This should be used to make the application wait until all
the sounds are loaded.  Currently it just logs a message.

add basic voice composition + start/stop button

* parse sound resources names to sort them in categories
* sound resources must be in res/raw/snd_CAT_ID where
  CAT is use as the caregory and ID is just to make the
  distinction between all the files
* start/stop a thread when pressing the button which runs
  the sound sequence

add basic sound management

* iterate over all existing raw resources
  (not checked-in yet)
* add all raw sound resources to a sound pool
* randomly pick a sound in the pool and play it
  when button is pressed
initial commit: empty HappyNewYear project
